entry.title: Yerevan‚Äôs arms control proposal still without reply from Baku

media:group.media:title: Yerevan‚Äôs arms control proposal still without reply from Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìç The International Committee of the Red Cross representatives have recently visited the Armenian detainees held in Azerbaijan. üìç Armenia has presented Azerbaijan with a written proposal to establish mutual arms control mechanisms and joint investigation of border incidents, Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan announced during the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva. üìç Armenia‚Äôs economy grows by 5.9% in 2024: https://youtu.be/I5DJRy1AuJQ?si=JFM63apvy7LTUsPq

entry.title: What is Azerbaijan doing to captive Vicken Euljekjian? #shorts

media:group.media:title: What is Azerbaijan doing to captive Vicken Euljekjian? #shorts
media:group.media:description:
A citizen of Lebanon and Armenia held captive by Azerbaijan for more than four years, he is a descendant of Armenian Genocide survivors. He moved to Nagorno-Karabakh in 2020 to start a business just prior to Azerbaijan‚Äôs attack. Euljekjian was one of the civilians captured by Azerbaijani forces and has been held in custody ever since. As reported by the human rights organization the Center for Truth & Justice, as a devout Christian, Euljekjian had a cross tattoo on his hand, which has been burned off by his Azerbaijani captors.
He was tried in a sham trial without legal defense and sentenced to 20 years in prison, where he remains today under notoriously inhumane conditions.
The Red Cross facilitates one call a month for him to speak to his family, who are forbidden from visiting him.
As his wife Linda told CivilNet: ‚Äúwhen we spoke last month, his condition was very bad and he expressed thoughts of suicide. However this month he was joking and laughing.. I don‚Äôt know why‚Ä¶‚Äù Linda says the behavior was unlike her husband, and believes that he is being drugged. This mirrors an assertion made last month by Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, who said that Armenia has learned Azerbaijan is using ‚Äúbanned psychoactive methods‚Äù against imprisoned Armenians ‚Äúin order to extort narratives and testimonies aimed at inciting regional escalation.‚Äù There are 23 confirmed prisoners of war, with allegations many more may be being held secretly.

media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan publicly addressed the ongoing trials of Armenian detainees in Baku for the first time in an international forum, speaking from the podium of the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva. üìç The Yerevan municipality has awarded the long-awaited completion of the city's iconic Cascade complex to local developer GTB. üìç Tackling Armenia‚Äôs educational shortcomings: https://youtu.be/psGVrQVyqhU?si=seJXw0m_5ftr76dy

entry.title: Des nouvelles du prisonnier de guerre Vicken Euljekjian #shorts

media:group.media:title: Des nouvelles du prisonnier de guerre Vicken Euljekjian #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Vicken Abraham Euljekjian fait partie des prisonniers de guerre arm√©niens d√©tenus en Azerba√Ødjan. En 2021, il a ete jug√© ill√©galement par le tribunal militaire de Bakou, reconnu coupable et condamn√© √† 20 ans de prison lors d‚Äôun proc√®s fictif.
CivilNet a contact√© son √©pouse, Linda Euljeckjian pour savoir si elle avait des nouvelles de son mari.

entry.title: France reaffirms defense cooperation with Armenia, defying Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: France reaffirms defense cooperation with Armenia, defying Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
üìç French Ambassador Olivier Decottignies confirmed that France will continue its defense partnership with Armenia despite recent demands from Azerbaijan. üìç Armenia‚Äôs residential real estate market may be cooling off after two years of unprecedented growth, according to Andranik Harutyunov, a member of the Armenian Real Estate Agencies Association Council. üìç CivilNet‚Äôs fact-checking unit has become the first Armenian member of the European Fact-Checking Standards Network. üìç Unmasking the Kremlin-Baku tensions: https://youtu.be/GohYLfndwUk?si=kk-wsGvVFCdKNeON

media:group.media:title: Tackling Armenia‚Äôs educational shortcomings
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, host Patrick Elliott sits down with Larisa Hovannisian, the founder of Teach For Armenia, to explore the organization's efforts to deliver quality education in the country's remote and underserved communities. Hovhannisian shares insights on the unique challenges facing rural schools, the government's ongoing education reforms, and the gaps between the current system and the skills needed for the modern Armenian economy.
